items.title: Biden aides discuss preemptive pardons for Trump targets, sources say | REUTERS
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
President Biden's top aides are contemplating preemptive pardons for certain public officials who may be targeted by the incoming Trump administration, although a final decision is yet to be made.

items.title: In Seoul, a brush with martial law draws dark memories | REUTERS
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
When President Yoon Suk Yeol declared martial law in South Korea for the first time since 1980, 70-year-old Lee Chul-Woo was reminded of his youth, much of which he spent protesting against right-wing military strongman rule.

As the war between Russia and Ukraine rages, trouble is brewing for NATOâ€™s EU countries. Beyond Russiaâ€™s aggression, subtle acts of hybrid warfare are forcing divided NATO members to confront a new reality: is Europe in a new â€˜Cold War?â€™ Senior European Security and Diplomatic correspondent Sabine Siebold joins the Reuters World News podcast to answer that question.

items.author: Reuters

items.title: Europe's new migrant hotspot races to cope with surging deaths
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
The number of migrants arriving from the West African coast to the Spanish archipelago of the Canary Islands is running at all-time highs. But the rate of migrants going missing or dying on the voyage is growing five times faster, the latest available data shows.

items.content:

items.title: LIVE: Notre-Dame Cathedral re-opens in Paris, five years after major fire
items.author: Reuters
items.content:
The centuries-old Paris landmark Notre-Dame Cathedral reopens today, five-and-a-half years after a devastating fire destroyed its spire and roof and brought the entire Gothic masterpiece within minutes of collapsing. The 860-year-old medieval building has been meticulously restored, with a new spire and rib vaulting, its flying buttresses and carved stone gargoyles returned to their past glory and the white stone and gold decorations shining brighter than ever. The state hands over the building to the Catholic church, the archbishop opens the door, and a liturgical celebration is held with singing and a blessing.
 
#Live #NotreDame #NotreDameCathedral #Paris #France #spire #CatholicChurch#EmmanuelMacron #DonaldTrump #news #Reuters

Keep up with the latest news from around the world: https://www.reuters.com/
